name: PostOrganizationalEntityByEmploymentId
description:
__Activity name:__ PostOrganizationalEntityByEmploymentId
    

Create an organizational entity for an employment

__Metadata :__ Possible options for fields of the type 'metadata' can be acquired (GET) by adding `/metadata` to the POST URL.

__Defaults :__ Default values for a new object can be acquired by adding `/defaults' to the POST URL.

employmentId.description: The unique identifier of the employment

Authorization.description: A valid Bearer token for authorizing the request.

Accept.description: The accept header is used to influence what type of output is returned and in most cases the version of the output

$ul: **obsoleteDate**: The date (can be null) on which the `resourceVersion` is no longer supported/available
**resourceVersion**: The resource version of the object in the response
**key**: The unique identifier of an object (GUID/UUID)
**deviatingFunctionDescription**: The deviating function description of the employment. This description deviates from the value of the `function` field.
**deviatingFunctionGroup**: The deviating function group description of the employment. Only applies when a deviating function description is defined.
**distributionUnit**: Distribution unit, used in several reports and the "basic wage journal" functionality. Commonly used as a cost center.
**key**: The unique identifier of an object (GUID/UUID)
**endDate**: The end date of the entity. The date is up to and including.
**key**: The unique identifier of an object (GUID/UUID)
**id**: The unique identifier of an object (GUID/UUID)
**internalTelephoneExtensionNumber**: The phone number of the standard working location (standplaats) for the employment.
**placeOfEmployment**: The standard working location (standplaats) for the employment.
**startDate**: The start date of the entity.
**obsoleteDate**: The date (can be null) on which the `resourceVersion` is no longer supported/available
**resourceVersion**: The resource version of the object in the response
